Creating Services database …\nThis may take a while …
%s must be installed from the market !
Discovery is canceled, because a mac address appeared multiple times, you probably are behind a proxy.\n\nGo to your Gateway from the browser : http://%s
Do you want to install the scan daemon for root ?
Enter an IP address or FQDN to scan, i.e. scanme.nmap.org

The method that is being used, does not need to have root privileges. In future release there will be more advanced techniques, once the non-root ones are polished.

Here is how it works: 
1. Calculate the subnetwork range
2. Iterate thought IP and query them
3. First it sends an ICMP ping or Echo on tcp/7 (with InetAddress.isReachable())
4. If it does not work, it tries to connect() on well known open tcp ports such as: 135, 139, 22, 111, 80
5. If none of the above is successful, the host is not discovered

Port scan is event driven, using Java's Selector and SocketChannel.
There is a fake timeout by registrering the time in ms at socket's creation and checking regularly this value.
The port scan method, as discovery, uses full tcp connection check. (will be more granular in the future with root features.)

A maximum of 127 Sockets are opened at a time, so this is not always accurate, but quite fast. Again, a new feature is coming that will adapt times between requests according to host response time (kind of software network congestion control)

A port is considered open when tcp connect() is fully successful, closed when no service is listening on the other end, or filtered when the timeout is reached.
Donate: If you like this app, you can buy me a beer.
Use system DNS to resolve ip addresses
Read banner from a connected socket (ex.: SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_5.1p1)
Timeout of a port connection in millisecondes
Scan over edge/3g/… usually leading to strange results, if any
Maximum number of threads to use in host discovery (1–256)
Pull and update MAC addresses database
Change to different method of host discovery
Error: First is bigger than Last !
Error: Number of Threads must be between 1 and 256 !
